locutie.beschrijving: Exegesis of the Rich Young Ruler and the metaphor of the camel/needle. Analysis of the spiritual dangers of wealth (dishonesty, addiction, false security, pride). Comparison between the rich ruler and Jesus as the 'Ultimate Rich Young Ruler'.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Uses intertextual references (Proverbs, John 4, Romans 3) to build a theological framework.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting theological truths and explaining the human condition, transitioning into a christological promise and a final directive for generosity.
voorbeelden: I think Jesus is saying the things that keep human beings... are accentuated by money.
I want you to leave your wealth.
He gave away the most incredible wealth... so that you can have the only wealth that lasts.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Conviction of idolatry (money), comfort through the Gospel (Jesus' sacrifice), and a resulting change in giving habits.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit. The preacher refers to the Gospel 'catching fire' and 'melting the heart', implying internal work beyond human rhetoric.

voorbeelden: The Bible sees wealth creation in more positive light than socialistic societies do.
Learn, explore, come, figure it out, and believe it.
Be willing to treat it as not yours.
Don't pat yourself on the back.
I had somebody who said, 'I wish I had your faith,' and I just wanted to strangle them.
Thank you, Father, for your generosity to us.
You will have treasure in heaven.
You can have the only wealth that lasts, God himself.
He's going to do it all for the love of you.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strongly Christocentric; the promise is rooted in the finished work of Christ rather than the hearer's effort.

voorbeelden: I say unto you, it’s that second man... who went down to his house justified.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Moderate. The preacher relies on the authority of the text rather than performing an immediate sacramental act like 'I absolve you'.

indicatoren: Extensive analysis of economic systems (capitalism vs socialism).
Lengthy explanation of the camel/needle metaphor.
Detailed list of four ways money is dangerous.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer gains significant intellectual insight into their heart-idolatry but may feel like they are in a lecture for the first 20 minutes.

missende_elementen: Immediate present-tense address of God's action now
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Delayed encounter; the 'event' only happens in the final third of the sermon.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High quality, shifting from the 'rich ruler' to 'Jesus for you'.
voorbeelden: I’m going to love you enough to give away the most incredible wealth... so that you can have the only wealth that lasts.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Directly challenging the hearer's relationship with money.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to apply the law and then the promise.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing the biblical characters and general economic principles.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a teaching atmosphere rather than an immediate encounter.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Narrating the Gospel story and Old Testament context.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about money and human psychology.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'now' of the Gospel application and the closing prayer.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from Assertive (Money is dangerous) to Declarative/Commissive (Jesus gave all for you) to Directive (Now be generous).
voorbeelden: Jesus gave up everything for you... Now, why don't you take your little all and be willing to treat it as not yours?

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because you were so generous with us, now we pray you would make us generous people.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: While heavy on constatives initially, the sermon successfully pivots to a performative 'event' by re-casting the identity of the hearer in light of Christ's 'commissive' act on the cross.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: I wasn’t talking about that rich young ruler. There are two rich young rulers in this story.
sterke_punten.effect: Moves the sermon from a lecture on ethics to a sacramental encounter with Grace.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The Bible’s attitude toward wealth does not really fit into a spectrum between free-market capitalism and socialism.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon becomes an event when it stops talking about the ruler and starts proclaiming Christ's sacrifice as the hearer's new reality.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The 'Toezegging' (Promise) is clear and central to the climax.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, through the 'Word of God' framing.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, especially in the 'I say unto you' and the application of the Gospel.
tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus is saying the same thing now to this guy [you].

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Implicitly, through the metaphor of 'fire' and 'melting hearts'.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Yes, the preacher acknowledges he can only provide the 'why', but the heart change is a miracle.
tekstueel_bewijs: Until it catches fire and begins to melt your hard heart.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon is treated as the vehicle for the 'living water'.
tekstueel_bewijs: Do you see the resources for deep, infinite comfort and joy that are there?

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on 'is' and 'says' (Assertive). It needs more 'gives' and 'forgives' (Commissive/Declarative) earlier in the text.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The Bible says everywhere it’s impossible that anyone would be good enough to be saved.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: I announce to you today: on your own, it is impossible for you to be saved, but God is doing the impossible in you right now.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a general truth to a present-tense declaration.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The toezegging is strong but late.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Interweave the promise of Christ's wealth throughout the analysis of the ruler's poverty.
voorbeeldzinnen: Even as you feel the sting of this idolatry, Christ promises you his own righteousness.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much time spent in the 3rd person (The ruler, The Bible, People).
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use more 'You' and 'Now' in the exegetical sections.
voorbeeldzinnen: Jesus is looking at you and loving you now.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Keep the 'sacrifice' imperative tied strictly to the 'Christ's sacrifice' indicative.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in shifting from Law to Gospel, though it risks losing the hearer in the 'constative' woods of the introduction.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT identifies that the preacher isn't just 'sending a message' about money, but 'performing' a transfer of identity from the hearer to Christ.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The power here isn't in the camel metaphor (rhetoric), but in the illocutionary force of the Promise (Commissive).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's 'event-character' is concentrated in the final 25% where the illocutionary force shifts from Assertive to Commissive.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: I’m going to love you enough to give away the most incredible wealth.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: The theological heart of the sermon.

appendices.notities: The sermon follows a classic 'Kellerian' structure: Law (Money is an idol) -> Gospel (Jesus is the true wealth) -> Response (Sacrificial giving).
